page.title: 06EDUCATION 2
page.content: A school has existed in Hullavington since{1833.}In that year{Sir Joseph { {Neeld,}owner of Grittleton House, founded a two roomed, stone building in the centre of the village.This school was enlarged in{1873}to coincide with the increased population provided by the 'Navigators', working on the Great Western Railway, & then living at Kingsway. Brick cloakrooms & an earth closet were added in {1914.}This school remained largely unaltered, with the exception of the additional use of temporary wooden 'Pratten' huts & the village hall, until{1971.'Phase one' of a new {Primary School,}built on a flat roofed, modular, 'Open Plan' design was erected at the North-Eastern end of the village at that date.Both buildings are still in use for the present 94 children & 5 teachers.
